name: Brie wrapped in prosciutto & brioche
instructions:
Mix the flour, 1 tsp salt, [INGREDIENT:53c20400:singular], [INGREDIENT:9c935c3b:singular], [INGREDIENT:ecbdb882:singular] and [INGREDIENT:ab92d9fa:plural] together in a mixer using the dough attachment for 5 mins until the dough is smooth. Add the [INGREDIENT:d74fdde2:singular] and mix for a further 4 mins on medium speed. Scrape the dough bowl and mix again for 1 min. Place the dough in a container, cover with cling film and leave in the fridge for at least 6 hrs before using.
Wrap the [INGREDIENT:464ec384:singular] in the [INGREDIENT:baf6c0ef:singular] and set aside. Turn out the dough onto a lightly floured surface. Roll into a 25cm circle. Place the wrapped [INGREDIENT:464ec384:singular] in the middle of the circle and fold the edges in neatly. Put the parcel onto a baking tray lined with baking parchment and brush with beaten egg. Chill in the fridge for 30 mins, then brush again with beaten egg and chill for a further 30 mins. Leave to rise for 1 hr at room temperature. Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6, then bake for 22 mins. Serve warm.
originalInstructions:
Mix the flour, 1 tsp salt, caster sugar, yeast, milk and eggs together in a mixer using the dough attachment for 5 mins until the dough is smooth. Add the butter and mix for a further 4 mins on medium speed. Scrape the dough bowl and mix again for 1 min. Place the dough in a container, cover with cling film and leave in the fridge for at least 6 hrs before using.
Wrap the Brie in the prosciutto and set aside. Turn out the dough onto a lightly floured surface. Roll into a 25cm circle. Place the wrapped Brie in the middle of the circle and fold the edges in neatly. Put the parcel onto a baking tray lined with baking parchment and brush with beaten egg. Chill in the fridge for 30 mins, then brush again with beaten egg and chill for a further 30 mins. Leave to rise for 1 hr at room temperature. Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6, then bake for 22 mins. Serve warm.
